message: Is this something that happened due to a Django upgrade?  But even the last DJango upgrade must have been long ago on our production server.
However, I did upgrade from South 0.7.2 to 0.7.3.

I have seen a somewhat strange schema migration made by south today.  I have multi-table inheritance, and the "backpointer" from the child to the parent model is a OneToOneField.  So far, so good.  But South now added primary_key=True to it.  I don't remember having changed anything with this model.
